newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - SRW wheat values steady-weak.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - SRW wheat values steady-weak.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf SRW wheat basis values were steady to weak in reaction to small amounts of new-crop wheat entering export channels, grain dealers said.
Soybean basis values eased slightly because of light export demand, and corn values were mostly unchanged.

Grain dealers said soft red winter wheat from Arkansas and southern Missouri was largely of good quality. However, much of it was going into short-term storage because farmers were disappointed with cash prices.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
FH August unq nc +34.5 + U unc
LH August unq nc +33.5 + U unc
FH Sept unq nc +32 + U unc
LH Sept unq nc +31 + U unc
Note: N=CBOT July, U=CBOT Sept, nc=no comparison.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
SRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
HRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis KCBT, cts/bu) -
LH June unq nc +44 + N unc
